definition: lit. secretly crossing the Wei River 渭河[Wei4 He2] at Chencang (idiom, refers to a stratagem used by Liu Bang 劉邦|刘邦[Liu2 Bang1] in 206 BC against Xiang Yu 項羽|项羽[Xiang4 Yu3] of Chu)/fig. to feign one thing while doing another/to cheat under cover of a diversion
variant of 暗[an4]
to close (a door)/to eclipse/muddled/stupid/ignorant/variant of 暗[an4]
dark/gloomy/hidden/secret/muddled/obscure/in the dark
to cross/to pass through/to ferry
surname Chen/Chen (c. 1045 - 479 BC), a Zhou dynasty state/Chen (557-589), one of the Southern Dynasties 南朝[Nan2 Chao2]
to lay out/to exhibit/to display/to narrate/to state/to explain/to tell/old/stale
barn/granary/storehouse/cabin/hold (in ship)

lit. repair the plank road by day while secretly crossing the Wei River 渭河[Wei4 He2] at Chencang (idiom, refers to a stratagem used by Liu Bang 劉邦|刘邦[Liu2 Bang1] in 206 BC against Xiang Yu 項羽|项羽[Xiang4 Yu3] of Chu)/fig. to feign one thing while doing another/to cheat under cover of a diversion
pinyin: ming2 xiu1 zhan4 dao4 , an4 du4 Chen2 cang1

sentences.english: You're moving one way and I'm planning my way.
sentences.chinese: 你明修栈道我暗渡陈仓咱各显其能。

sentences.english: The disk, clearly is repairing the surreptitious.
sentences.chinese: 而盘面，分明就是明修栈道，暗渡陈仓。

sentences.english: The children cheated. They said they were going to a rescheduled class, but they played computer games instead.
sentences.chinese: 这帮孩子暗渡陈仓，说是补课竟然去打游戏了。

definition: to threaten the east and strike to the west (idiom)/to create a diversion
to lure the tiger from its domain in the mountains (idiom)/to lure an enemy away from his territory
lit. to besiege 魏[Wei4] and rescue 趙|赵[Zhao4] (idiom)/fig. to relieve a besieged ally by attacking the home base of the besiegers
lit. the plum tree withers in place of the peach tree/to substitute one thing for another/to carry the can for sb
to cross the sea by a trick (idiom)/to achieve one's aim by underhanded means
to beat sb at their own game (idiom)
to obtain safe passage to conquer the State of Guo/to borrow the resources of an ally to attack a common enemy (idiom)
lit. please Sir, get into the boiling pot (idiom)/fig. to give sb a taste of his own medicine
interlocked stratagems/CL:條|条[tiao2]
to conspire openly/overt plot
to catch a thief by closing his escape route (idiom)
to lend sb a knife to kill sb/to get sb else to do one's dirty work/to attack using the strength of another (idiom)
lit. a short-cut to crush Guo (idiom); fig. to connive with sb to damage a third party, then turn on the partner
stratagem of sowing dissension/CL:條|条[tiao2]
lit. to pull a snake from its hole/to expose a malefactor (idiom)
lit. the cicada sheds its carapace (idiom); fig. to vanish leaving an empty shell/a crafty escape plan
